alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 2:57PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO CREATE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS OVER PORTIONS OF EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN TONIGHT... A low pressure system passing south of the area will bring a round of light snow to east-central Wisconsin tonight. The snow across southern Wisconsin will have to overcome dry air across portions of east-central Wisconsin, resulting in a slower arrival of the light snow this evening. The snow will slowly creep north during the evening, and then continue into early Sunday morning before diminishing and ending after sunrise across far eastern Wisconsin. One to three inches of snow is expected along and south of a line from Wautoma to Appleton to Kewaunee. Two to four inches of snow is expected in Manitowoc county, with locally higher amounts possible near Lake Michigan. Temperatures will remain well below freezing, so roads are likely to become snow-covered and slippery once the snow begins. In addition, gusty northeast winds could result in some blowing and drifting snow overnight, especially near Lake Michigan. Anyone planning to travel across east-central Wisconsin tonight should be prepared for hazardous travel conditions due to snow- covered and slippery roads. Be sure to allow extra travel time so you can reach your destination safely.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Waushara; Winnebago
